title: Insulinoma Causing Hypoglycemic Episodes
setup_script: “A 35-year-old woman presents with recurrent episodes of diaphoresis, tremor, and confusion that are relieved by eating. During a clinic visit, her fasting glucose is found to be 40 mg/dL with inappropriately elevated insulin and C-peptide levels. Abdominal MRI demonstrates a 1 cm lesion in the pancreatic tail. How would you proceed with this patient?”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident asks about confirming diagnosis
dynamic_flow.reply: “A supervised fast shows recurrent hypoglycemia with elevated insulin, C-peptide, and proinsulin levels. Sulfonylurea screen is negative.”
“What entities would you consider in the differential diagnosis for hypoglycemia in this patient?”
“Endoscopic ultrasound confirms a 1 cm lesion in the tail of the pancreas, consistent with insulinoma.”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident asks about management options
dynamic_flow.reply: “What are your treatment options for this patient?”
“What surgical approaches are available for a small insulinoma in the tail of the pancreas?”
“The lesion is close to the pancreatic duct. What is your operative plan now?”
“How would you approach this operation laparoscopically, and what factors would influence whether you preserve the spleen?”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident does not address preoperative optimization
dynamic_flow.reply: “How would you manage this patient preoperatively?”
“Intraoperative ultrasound confirms the lesion in the tail of the pancreas. Please describe your operative steps.”
“The patient remains stable intraoperatively, but postoperative glucose levels are elevated. How would you manage this?”
“Pathology confirms a well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor consistent with insulinoma, Ki-67 index < 2%. What is your next step in postoperative care?”
“The patient has elevated drain amylase on postoperative day 3. How do you manage this finding?”
“What is your plan for surveillance and counseling of this patient after discharge?”

critical_decision_points: Confirming diagnosis of insulinoma with supervised fasting and biochemical markers
Localizing the tumor with appropriate imaging and endoscopic ultrasound
Choosing operative approach (enucleation vs distal pancreatectomy)
Counseling regarding recurrence risk and follow-up

Your operative planning showed solid knowledge of surgical options and you articulated your management plan clearly.Areas for Improvement: Earlier discussion of preoperative glucose management and detailed planning for pancreatic fistula prevention would strengthen your approach.
